metadata.title: YouTube Playlist Strategy 2025: Organize for More Watch Time
metadata.description: Create YouTube playlists that boost watch time. Organization strategies for growth.

hero.headline: YouTube Playlist Strategy Guide
hero.subheadline: Keep viewers watching. Organize content for maximum watch time.

sections.content: Playlists are watch time multipliers—when one video ends, the next starts automatically. Strategic playlists guide viewers through your content, increase session time, and organize your channel professionally. Here's how to create playlists that keep viewers watching.

sections.title: Playlist Best Practices
content: Share playlist links, not video links

faq.question: How many playlists should I have?
faq.answer: Depends on content volume. Start with 3-5 main categories. Don't over-segment small catalogs. Add playlists as content grows. Quality organization matters more than quantity.

faq.question: Should I put videos in multiple playlists?
faq.answer: Yes—one video can be in multiple playlists where relevant. Course playlist AND topic playlist. Increases discovery paths. Don't force-fit though.

faq.question: Do playlists help SEO?
faq.answer: Yes—playlists appear in search results. Well-titled playlists can rank. Playlist pages are indexable. Treat playlist titles like video titles for SEO.

faq.question: What order for videos in playlist?
faq.answer: For courses: chronological/logical progression. For topics: best performer first to hook viewers. Experiment with order. First video matters most—it's the entry point.
